sub_topic: Probability of a certain weather event occurring
message_1: What is the probability of flipping a coin twice and getting two tails in a row? (Assuming a fair coin)
message_2: The probability of getting a tail in one flip of a fair coin is 1/2. Since the flips are independent events, the probability of getting two tails in a row is the product of the probabilities of getting a tail in each flip. So, the probability of getting two tails in a row is (1/2) * (1/2) = 1/4 or 25%.
